usefulItems: bowl, large serving bowl, plastic wrap, refrigerator
title: Layered Mexican dip

ingredients.content: 250 g ripe tomatoes (approx. 2-3 tomatoes), deseeded and cut into quarters
1 jalapeño chilli, trimmed and cut into halves (optional)
fresh coriander, leaves only, for garnishing

preparations.content: Place all salsa ingredients into mixing bowl and chop <b>4 sec/speed 5<b>. Transfer into simmering basket and place over a bowl to drain. Cover and place into refrigerator until ready to use. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Place cashews and pine nuts into mixing bowl and mill <b>5 sec/speed 10<b>.
Add lemon juice, water and salt and blend <b>1 min/speed 8<b>. Transfer into a bowl, cover and place into refrigerator until ready to use. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Place avocados, lime juice, salt and pepper into mixing bowl and mash <b>4 sec/speed 4<b>. Transfer into a bowl and place into refrigerator until ready to use.

Place a large serving bowl onto mixing bowl lid, then weigh refried beans into it. Use spatula to create a smooth, even surface. Gently spread the Avocado mash on top of the beans, followed by a layer of the Sour "cream".  Top with iceberg lettuce, then reserved Salsa and grated cheese. Garnish with coriander and serve with corn chips (see Tips).

hintsAndTricks: To make your own Vegan cheese and Refried beans, refer to the recipes on this recipe chip.

You can store the Sour "cream" in the refrigerator for up to 3 days. You can store the dip in the refrigerator for up to 2 days (although we recommend adding the lettuce and chips just before serving).
